channel.title: RSWiki
channel.description:
super_ and I were discussing the documenting of the rs2 protocol/client in a wiki format (since he did some work with graham/blakeman on their currently nonexistent wiki). If anyone has any pages or input they'd like to commit, the link is below:
http://rswiki.gyrat.in/index.php?title=Main_Page
Only registered users can create/edit pages; once the majority of people who want to be involved register, I will close registration to ensure the wiki information will remain as accurate as possible.
Discuss.
EDIT: also, if anyone has a nice logo that I could use for the wiki, that would also be helpful (I was thinking the bulldozer, I just need a medium-sized, transparent image).

item.title: RSWiki
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“Rix_, post:32, topic:399357”]Did you recently add proxy detection to the website?

I keep receiving a “Proxy detected” message whenever I try to view the website on my wi-fi connection. Funny because I manage to bypass using this web proxy.[/quote]
I was messing around, no worries - fixed.

Read full topic

I will be transferring all information to the new wiki today.

item.title: RSWiki
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:28, topic:399357”]Here is the latest runewiki db:

Insert that into your MySQL server like so:

I removed all entries in the user table to avoid giving away private account info, so you will need to insert at least 1 admin account probably. Other than that it hasn’t been touched, and you should be able to figure it out hopefully. I know mediawiki is notoriously hard to get to cooperate with any type of move, import, or the like, but hopefully you can get it to the point where you can grab the info you need.

If you need anything else, let me know.[/quote]
downloading and installing a mirror under a different database name on my server

edit: attempted to install a copy of media wiki, drop the database’s entries and import yours - failed miserably.

edit2: all working an contains lots of nice information, thanks!

Read full topic

item.title: RSWiki
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Here is the latest runewiki db:

https://www.moparisthebest.com/downloads/runewiki.truncated_users.sql.bz2

Insert that into your MySQL server like so:

I removed all entries in the user table to avoid giving away private account info, so you will need to insert at least 1 admin account probably. Other than that it hasn’t been touched, and you should be able to figure it out hopefully. I know mediawiki is notoriously hard to get to cooperate with any type of move, import, or the like, but hopefully you can get it to the point where you can grab the info you need.

If you need anything else, let me know.

Read full topic

item.title: RSWiki
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“mutex_, post:24, topic:399357”][quote author=T4_ link=topic=496494.msg3631390#msg3631390 date=1308253438]

Although in the US the DMCA could probably be twisted to say that you obtained that information illegally. Because the DMCA can do almost anything lololol

I shall be stingy on who I allow access

http://rswiki.gyrat.in/index.php?title=317_Protocol

i’ll document a few packets sometime this week

Good job, abraham - it’s a start.
[/quote]That’s all he is able to do.[/quote]
mutex_, contribute what you know instead of measuring e-peen?

EDIT: a good deal of information was added and templates were created for most information. I’ve gathered most of what super_ has posted around so far. I still need incoming/outgoing packet documentation, though.

Read full topic

item.title: RSWiki
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:19, topic:399357”][quote author=mutex_ link=topic=496494.msg3630915#msg3630915 date=1308200308]
If you expose too much of the client and Jagex found out about the exposure, wouldn’t that result in lawsuits?
[/quote]
No. Information isn’t against the law.[/quote]
Exactly, saying, for example, a packet with opcode 73 contains the information for the pId of the attacking player and whatnot isn’t against any law…

item.title: RSWiki
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

Newty:

Obviously I read the thread; I saw that the wiki was located at a sub domain and I was merely offering a better solution…

I’m in control of the domain, and if it were hosted here (mitb) I’m sure it would also be a subdomain. I understand your post better, and I thank you for your wanting to help. But at this point in time I think it’s better if we have a wiki that isn’t a blank page…

Read full topic

item.title: RSWiki
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:14, topic:399357”]Yep, keep weekly backups at a minimum, and keep a copy of them off-site as well in case a hard drive or your whole host goes down. rsync and/or rdiff-backup is nice for this.

@wiki, do you still need a backup of the runewiki database?[/quote]
If it contains nothing about client -> server communications and such or anything USEFUL, it isn’t worth anyone’s time.

But also, it seems everyone in this thread keeps missing the point: it needs content, I sure as hell am not qualified to write about it (and there’s obviously people here who are with minimal effort).

Read full topic

item.title: RSWiki
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:

Yep, keep weekly backups at a minimum, and keep a copy of them off-site as well in case a hard drive or your whole host goes down. rsync and/or rdiff-backup is nice for this.

@wiki, do you still need a backup of the runewiki database?

Read full topic

item.title: RSWiki
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

Newty:

I could purchase a domain for this if you want.

Did you not read the thread? We’ve got a domain, I own it.

Moparisthebest:

I could even host it if someone else wanted to administrate it, I don’t want to. That was the problem with the other ones, no administration.

I am fine with myself administrating/hosting it, hosting is provided by Mopman’s bitdash (I’ve got lifetime trial ). If it so happens that I lose hosting or the domain, I will always keep a backup and not just lose it like Graham.

What needs to be done is adding content; ahem: super_, frank_, Moparisthebest(?), abraham2119, etc…

Read full topic
